definitions.definition: Any style in art , architecture , literature , philosophy , etc., that reacts against an earlier modernist movement .
An attitude of skepticism or irony toward modernist ideologies, often questioning the assumptions of Enlightenment rationality and rejecting the idea of objective truth.

main_definition: Any style in art , architecture , literature , philosophy , etc., that reacts against an earlier modernist movement .
secondary_definitions: An attitude of skepticism or irony toward modernist ideologies, often questioning the assumptions of Enlightenment rationality and rejecting the idea of objective truth.
